voicesplitting.generic

Class MidiModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • voicesplitting.generic.MidiModel
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    VoiceSplittingModel

    public abstract class MidiModel
extends java.lang.Object
    A MidiModel is a generic interface which defines any model which takes a series of MidiNotes as input through the handleIncoming(List) method, and generates some sort of hypotheses, which can be obtained through the getHypotheses() method.
    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 4 Sept, 2015

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MidiModel() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract java.util.TreeSet<? extends MidiModelState> getHypotheses()
      This method returns a TreeSet of the current hypothesis states of this MidiModel.
      abstract void handleIncoming(java.util.List<MidiNote> notes)
      This method takes as input some List of MidiNotes, and then does some work on the notes, updating its list of hypotheses in the process.
      java.lang.String toString()

    • Method Detail

      • handleIncoming

        public abstract void handleIncoming(java.util.List<MidiNote> notes)
        This method takes as input some List of MidiNotes, and then does some work on the notes, updating its list of hypotheses in the process.
        Parameters:
        notes - A List of the MidiNotes which we want to handle next.

      • getHypotheses

        public abstract java.util.TreeSet<? extends MidiModelState> getHypotheses()
        This method returns a TreeSet of the current hypothesis states of this MidiModel.
        Returns:
        A TreeSet of the current hypothesis states of this MidiModel, sorted by score.
